intro: Orostachys furusei, commonly known as the Japanese stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves that form a dense rosette. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or white during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Orostachys furusei is also known for its ability to survive in harsh environments, showcasing its resilience and adaptability.
